vpn.ovpn_desc: OpenVPN is an open-source software application that implements virtual private network (OpenVPN) techniques for creating secure point-to-point or site-to-site connections in routed or bridged configurations and remote access facilities, please follow the steps below:
vpn.ovpn_step_tip2: 2. Modify the default configuration, then save;
vpn.ovpn_step_tip3: 3. Export the client configuration file to your client device;
vpn.ovpn_step_tip4: 4. Go to the VPN Dashbord page and start the VPN server.
vpn.ovpn_tips: You don't have any OpenVPN configuration files yet, please get started by generating a new one.
vpn.wg_desc: WireGuard® is an extremely simple, fast and modern VPN that utilizes state-of-the-art cryptography. Please follow the steps below:
vpn.wg_step_tip3: 3. Copy peer information to the client;
vpn.wg_step_tip4: 4. Go to the VPN Dashboard page and start the VPN server.
vpn.wg_tips1: You don't have any peer configuration yet. Get started by adding a peer configuration.
vpn.autodetec_desc: The routing rules defined in each VPN client configuration file or issued by the VPN server will be used.
vpn.custom_route_desc: You can manually configure routing rules for each VPN client instance.
vpn.choose_config_file_tips: You can switch the configuration file when the client is running, and the process of switching the configuration file will not cause traffic leakage.
vpn.mtu_tips: The MTU you set for the instance will overwrite the MTU item in the configuration file.
vpn.default_metric_tips: In auto detect mode, the routing rules in the instance will write the routing table with the default metric. The smaller the metric value, the higher the priority of the routing rule.
vpn.client_starting: The client is starting, please wait…
vpn.route_rule_tips: In customize routes mode, the VPN client will ignore the configuration file and the routing configuration issued by the server. Whether to use the encrypted tunnel provided by the VPN when accessing any network segment is determined by the routing rules you manually set.
vpn.upload_tips: Please visit $$$$ VPN on Router $$$$ to view OpenVPN compatible VPN service providers and learn about the benefits of using VPN.
vpn.upload_desc: Follow your VPN service provider's guide, download the WireGuard configuration file, and import the configuration file to the router.
vpn.rootcert_tips: The root certificate file has been parsed:
vpn.needauth_tips: $$$$ valid configuration files are detected. Please enter the username and password. If these configurations use different passwords, you will need to manually enter the password for each configuration file:
vpn.needinfo_tips: $$$$ valid configuration files need to enter the passphrase, please make sure that these configurations use the same passphrase:
vpn.unpassed_tips: The following $$$$ are not valid configuration files. These files will be discarded when the compressed package is confirmed:
vpn.auth_desc: The authentication information you enter here will overwrite the authentication information in the configuration file.
vpn.name: Name
vpn.ovpn_init_tips: When generating the OpenVPN server, the router will automatically generate encrypted files such as the server root certificate for you to protect your communication security. If you are familiar with OpenVPN, you can also $$$$enter manually$$$$.
vpn.client_auth_tips: The router will automatically generate a server and client certificate-key, and write into the configuration file when generating the client configuration file.
vpn.use_ddns_export_tips: Use DDNS domain to avoid that the client cannot connect to the service because of the change of the public network IP. If you want to use this function, please $$$$Enable DDNS$$$$ on your router and it can be resolved successfully.
vpn.no_auth_tips: Username/Password authentication is not enabled, the configured username and password will not take effect.
vpn.generate_peer_tips1: Please download the WireGuard® app in Google Play or App Store, then use the app to scan the QR code to connect to your server.
vpn.generate_peer_tips2: Please copy the following configuration to your WireGuard client.
vpn.kill_switch_tips: If this option is enabled, all traffic from client devices trying to be sent out of the VPN tunnel will be blocked, which will effectively prevent VPN leaks due to client DNS settings, dropped VPN connections, client apps requesting by IP, etc.
vpn.policy_nav_title: When client accesses the network with your router$$$$how do you want the router to differentiate whether the traffic uses a VPN encrypted tunnel?
vpn.access_by_sites_desc: In domain name/IP mode, you can set which websites to visit with VPN, or you can set which websites to visit without VPN.
vpn.access_by_dev: Differentiate by The Clients Accessing Network
vpn.access_by_dev_desc: In MAC filtering mode, you can accurately set whether each client in your local area network accesses the Internet with VPN by the MAC address of the client.
vpn.domain_name_tips: The domain name in the list will also match its own subdomain (For example, google.com will match mail.google.com).
vpn.mac_exception: Exception For Traffic from Following Device
vpn.base_on_web_tips: In this mode, only the traffic of certain websites $$$$defined by IP address or domain name$$$$ will go through VPN. Only one VPN client instance can be activated.
vpn.base_on_device_tips: In this mode, only the traffic of certain local client devices $$$$defined by MAC address$$$$ will go through VPN. Only one VPN client instance can be activated.
vpn.base_on_vlan_tips: In this mode, $$$$only the traffic of certain VLAN$$$$ can go through the VPN. Only one VPN client instance can be activated.
vpn.global_proxy_tips: All traffic will go through VPN. Only one VPN client instance can be activated.
vpn.set_key_manually_tips: The router will automatically generate a key pair for you. If you are familiar with WireGuard and want to update the key pair or add a pre-shared key, you can also set key manually.
vpn.wgserver_peer_list_desc: Each client device to connect to the WireGuard server requires a unique peer configuration, you need to create a configuration for each device. Each configuration must use a unique client IP.
vpn.has_auth_tips: Username/password verification is enabled, and client devices require any username/password from the list to connect to the OpenVPN server.
vpn.peer_deprecated_tips: The configuration of the client peer is invalid due to the change in server configuration, please create a new peer configuration for your device.
vpn.advanced_configuration_tips: If you are familiar with OpenVPN, you can also manually modify advanced configuration.
vpn.users_empty_tips: The user list is empty, you need to add at least one user to connect to OpenVPN server.
vpn.use_client_tips: Prefer using $$$$other VPN service providers$$$$ or $$$$customizing your own VPN server$$$$ ? Create a new group to add your configuration files.
vpn.loaction_label_tips: The router will only get configuration profiles for servers located in the regions you choose. The more regions you choose, the longer it will take to get the profiles.
vpn.wg_revoke_key_tips: Failed to generate a WireGuard key. You can only have up to five keys at the same time per Mullvad account. Please go to $$$$Mullvad$$$$ to revoke a key.
vpn.local_access_tips: If this option is enabled, resources inside the LAN subnet can be accessed through the VPN tunnel.
vpn.masq_tips: If this option is enabled, When clients devices on LAN send their IP packets, the router replaces the source IP address with its own address and then forwards it to the VPN tunnel.
vpn.use_vpn_only_tips: If this option is enabled, while VPN is connected, client devices will still be able to access WAN, e.g. accessing your printer, NAS etc in upper subnet.
vpn.disable_vpn_for_services: Services from GL.iNet don't Use VPN
vpn.disable_vpn_for_services_tips: If this option is enabled, services on routers that usually require the use of a real IP will not use VPN. Including GoodCloud, DDNS, rtty.
vpn.nordvpn_setup_guide: It is service credentials of NordVPN. If you don't know how to get it, please see $$$$Setup Guide$$$$.
vpn.third_lead_tips: Request the VPN configuration file from your VPN service provider.
vpn.domain_required_tips: Using the current list, you must add a domain name or IP
vpn.mac_required_tips: Using the current list, you must add a device
vpn.enable_vpn_cascading_tips: If this option is enabled, when you have both VPN server and VPN Client running on this router, clients connected to the VPN server will further be routed to the VPN client tunnel. This is also called VPN cascading.
vpn.auth_conflict_tips: The authentication methods used by the profiles in a group must be the same. Please upload different files from providers to different groups separately.
